result.query:
Please find the name of the catalyst and co-catalyst name from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
Please only generate the name of the catalyst and nothing else. Such as TiO2. ZrO2 or Ag, etc.
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.

co_catalyst: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference:
Abstract
h i g h l i g h t sNi-incorporated TiO 2 was synthesized using a solvothermal method.The photocatalytic activity was measured by the reduction of CO 2 to CH 4 .14 lmolg catal of CH 4 was produced during 60 min using Ni-TiO 2 (0.1 mol).g r a p h i c a l a b s t r a c t Photocatalytic CO 2 reduction with H 2 O to CH 4 over TiO 2 and Ni-TiO 2 .
Experimental

methane yield over TiO 2 and Ni-TiO 2 photocatalysts in circulated liquid photoreactor system.The methane was just produced when light on and the highest amount was produced at the first time.After 60 min irradiation, the observed methane yields of catalysts order was: Ni-TiO 2 (0.1 mol) Ni-TiO 2 (0.5 mol) TiO 2 Ni-TiO 2 (1.0 mol).The best catalyst was Ni-TiO 2 (0.1 mol) with a maximum methane yield about 14 lmolg catal during 60 min.However, the yield of methane was gradually decreased in repeated

CO 2 gases were removed by flow the catalyst samples at 323 K for 30 min.The furnace temperature was increased from 323 to 973 K at a rate of 10 C min A1 under He flow. The photocatalytic tests for reduction of CO 2 with H 2 O were carried out in a circulated liquid photo reactor designed in our laboratory.There are three major systems -photo reactor, gas circulator, and analytic system (Fig. 2).To photoreduce of CO 2 , 0.5 g of TiO 2 or Ni-TiO 2 was added to 1.0 L of water in a Pyrex reactor.UV-lamps (6 A

samples.In general, basicity of catalysts is confirmed from CO 2 -TPD.There is only one peak for pure TiO 2 at 573 K 37, but two peaks are observed at about 523 K (small) and 573 (highest) for Ni-TiO 2 .That peak intensity of Ni-TiO 2 is stronger and shifted to high temperature than that of TiO 2 .Therefore addition of nickel increases the interaction between catalysts surface and CO 2 . Methane yield was used to evaluate the performance of the catalysts.Fig. 11 summarizes the methane yield over TiO 2 and

of TiO 2 .This is attributed to nickel atoms capture the excited electrons and reduce the electron-hole recombination process 35.The PL intensity of Ni-TiO 2 (0.1 mol) is the smallest when compared to other catalysts.However, the PL intensity is increased at higher nickel content.It indicates that high content of Ni do not act as a trapping site to capture the photogenerated electron from TiO 2 conduction band 36.Fig. 10 shows the CO 2 -TPD profile of TiO 2 and Ni-TiO 2 samples.In general, basicity of

Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.

evidence.pdf_reference: a Pyrex reactor.UV-lamps (6 A 3 W cm A2 18 W cm A2 , 20 cm length A 2.0 diameter, Shinan, Korea) emitting light at 365 nm were used to irradiate the solution.Supercritical fluid-grade CO 2 (UHP CO 2 ) was used in this study.It is composed of CO 2 99.999, H 2 O 1.50 ppm, O 2 1.50 ppm, CO 0.10 ppm and THC (CH 4 ) 1.00 ppm.Before illumination, the CO 2 gas was initially introduced to purge at the circulatory system.After that, the reactor was closed, and then lamp and gas circulator was switched on to start
